  • Exports
Source   Edit  

Module for the data model. This module contains data types used in the library.

Imports

common, private/data, private/utils, version

Types

Effect {.packed.} = object
  effectType*: uint8 ## Type of the effect, should be in range of the EffectType enum,
                     ## unknown types are ignored.
                     ## 
  param*: uint8 ## Effect parameter byte, only needed for certain types.
                ##
Effect column. An effect has a type and a parameter. Source   Edit   
EffectColumns = range[1'u8 .. 3'u8]
Range for the number of columns that are visible for a track. Source   Edit   
EffectCounts = array[4, EffectColumns]
Number of effects to display for each channel. Source   Edit   
EffectIndex = range[0 .. 2]
Index type for an Effect in a TrackRow. Source   Edit   
EffectType = enum
  etNoEffect = 0,           ## No effect, this effect column is unset.
  etPatternGoto,            ## Bxx begin playing given pattern immediately
  etPatternHalt,            ## C00 stop playing
  etPatternSkip,            ## D00 begin playing next pattern immediately
  etSetTempo,               ## Fxx set the tempo
  etSfx,                    ## Txx play sound effect
  etSetEnvelope,            ## Exx set the persistent envelope/wave id setting
  etSetTimbre,              ## Vxx set persistent duty/wave volume setting
  etSetPanning,             ## Ixy set channel panning setting
  etSetSweep,               ## Hxx set the persistent sweep setting (CH1 only)
  etDelayedCut,             ## Sxx note cut delayed by xx frames
  etDelayedNote,            ## Gxx note trigger delayed by xx frames
  etLock,                   ## L00 (lock) stop the sound effect on the current channel
  etArpeggio,               ## 0xy arpeggio with semi tones x and y
  etPitchUp,                ## 1xx pitch slide up
  etPitchDown,              ## 2xx pitch slide down
  etAutoPortamento,         ## 3xx automatic portamento
  etVibrato,                ## 4xy vibrato
  etVibratoDelay,           ## 5xx delay vibrato xx frames on note trigger
  etTuning,                 ## Pxx fine tuning
  etNoteSlideUp,            ## Qxy note slide up
  etNoteSlideDown,          ## Rxy note slide down
  etSetGlobalVolume          ## Jxy set global volume scale
Enumeration for all available effects. Source   Edit   
InfoString = array[32, char]
Fixed-length string of 32 characters, used for artist information. Source   Edit   
Instrument = object
  name*: string              ## Optional name of the instrument.
                             ## 
  channel*: ChannelId ## Channel this instrument is to be previewed on. Note that instruments
                      ## can be used on any channel, so this field is purely informational.
                      ## 
  sequences*: array[SequenceKind, Sequence] ## Sequence data for this instrument.
                                            ##
Container for a Trackerboy instrument. An instrument provides frame level control of a channel's parameters and is activated on each note trigger. Source   Edit   
InstrumentTable = Table[Instrument]
Container for Instruments. Up to 64 Instruments can be stored in this table and is addressable via a TableId. Source   Edit   
Module {.requiresInit.} = object
  songs*: SongList           ## The list of songs for this module.
                             ## 
  instruments*: InstrumentTable ## The module's instrument table, shared with all songs
                                ## 
  waveforms*: WaveformTable  ## The module's waveform table, shared with all songs
                             ## 
  title*, artist*, copyright*: InfoString ## Optional information about the module
                                          ## 
  comments*: string          ## Optional comment information about the module
                             ## 
  tickrate*: Tickrate        ## Tickrate used by all songs in the module.
                             ## 
  private*: ModulePrivate ## Internal details only accessible to the library, do not use!
                          ##
A module is a container for songs, instruments and waveforms. Each module can store up to 256 songs, 64 instruments and 64 waveforms. Instruments and Waveforms are shared between all songs. Source   Edit   
ModulePiece = Instrument | Song | Waveform
Type class for an individual component of a module. Source   Edit   
Order {.requiresInit.} = object
An Order is a sequence of OrderRows, that determine the layout of a Song. Each Order must have at least 1 OrderRow and no more than 256 rows. Source   Edit   
OrderId = uint8
Integer ID type for an OrderRow in an Order. Source   Edit   
OrderRow = array[ChannelId, TrackId]
An OrderRow is a set of TrackIds, one for each channel. Source   Edit   
OrderSize = PositiveByte
Size range of a song order. Source   Edit   
Sequence = object
  loopIndex*: Option[ByteIndex] ## If set, the sequence will loop to this index at the end. If unset
                                ## or the index exceeds the bounds of the sequence data, the sequence
                                ## will stop at the end instead.
                                ##
A sequence is a sequence of parameter changes with looping capability. (Not to be confused with a Nim sequence, seq[T]). Source   Edit   
SequenceKind = enum
  skArp, skPanning, skPitch, skTimbre, skEnvelope
Enumeration for the kinds of parameters a sequence can operate on. An Instrument has a Sequence for each one of these kinds. Source   Edit   
SequenceSize = range[0 .. high(uint8).int]
Size range a sequence's data can be. Source   Edit   
SomeData = Instrument | Waveform
Type class matching data that is contained in a Table. Source   Edit   
SomeTable = InstrumentTable | WaveformTable
Type class for a Table type. Source   Edit   
SomeTrack = Track | TrackView
Type class for all Track types. Source   Edit   
Song {.requiresInit.} = object
  name*: string              ## Name of the song.
                             ## 
  rowsPerBeat*: ByteIndex ## Number of rows that make up a beat. Used for tempo calculation
                          ## and by the front end for row highlights.
                          ## 
  rowsPerMeasure*: ByteIndex ## Number of rows that make up a measure. Used only by the front
                             ## end for row highlights.
                             ## 
  speed*: Speed ## Starting speed of the song when playing back, in frames/row.
                ## 
  effectCounts*: array[4, EffectColumns] ## Effect columns visible counts. To be used by the front end for
                                         ## the number of effect columns shown for each channel.
                                         ## 
  order*: Order              ## The song's Order
                             ## 
  trackLen*: TrackLen        ## The number of rows each track in the song is.
                             ## 
  tickrate*: Option[Tickrate] ## Tickrate override for this song. If set to none, the module's tickrate
                              ## should be used instead.
                              ##
Song type. Contains track data for a single song. Source   Edit   
SongList {.requiresInit.} = object
Container for songs. Songs stored in this container are references, like InstrumentTable and WaveformTable. A SongList can contain 1-256 songs. Source   Edit   
Speed = range[16.uint8 .. 240'u8.uint8]
Range of a Song's speed setting. Note that speed is in units of frames/row and is in fixed point format (Q4.4) Source   Edit   
System = enum
  systemDmg,                ## DMG/CGB system, 59.7 Hz
  systemSgb,                ## SGB system, 61.1 Hz
  systemCustom               ## Custom tick rate
Enumeration for types of systems the module is for. The system determines the vblank interval, or tick rate, of the engine. Source   Edit   
TableId = range[0'u8 .. 63'u8]
Integer ID type for items in an InstrumentTable or WaveformTable. Source   Edit   
Tickrate = object
  system*: System            ## Use a predefined system's tick rate
                             ## 
  customFramerate*: float32  ## Custom tick rate when `system = systemCustom`
                             ##
Defines the tickrate, or interval in which a single tick or step of a song when playing back. Source   Edit   
Track = object
  when NimMajor >= 2:
      len*: TrackLen = TrackLen.low

  else:
      len*: TrackLen

Pattern data for a single track. A track can store up to 256 rows. The data is stored using ref semantics, so assigning a track from another track will result in a shallow copy. Use the init proc to deep copy a track if needed. A Track is invalid if it was default initialized, or if its internal data ref is nil. Use isValid() to check for validity.

Regarding mutability, all Track objects are mutable. If you need immutable access, use TrackView. A Track can be converted to a TrackView at no cost, but the opposite is not true. Converting a TrackView to a Track will result in a deep copy of the TrackView's data being made.

Source   Edit   
TrackId = uint8
Integer ID type for a Track in a Song. Source   Edit   
TrackLen = PositiveByte
Size range of a Track Source   Edit   
TrackRow {.packed.} = object
  note*: uint8 ## The note index to trigger with a bias of 1 (0 means unset).
               ## 
  instrument*: uint8 ## The index of the instrument to set with a bias of 1 (0 means unset).
                     ## 
  effects*: array[EffectIndex, Effect] ## 3 available effect columns
                                       ##
A single row of data in a Track. Guaranteed to be 8 bytes. Source   Edit   
TrackView {.borrow: `.`.} = distinct Track
Same as track, but only provides immutable access to the track data. Mutable access can be acquired by converting the view to a Track via the Track.init overload, while making a deep copy of the data. Source   Edit   
WaveData = array[16, uint8]
Waveform data. A waveform consists of 16 bytes, with each byte containing 2 4-bit PCM samples. The first sample is the upper nibble of the byte, with the second being the lower nibble. Source   Edit   
Waveform = object
  name*: string              ## Optional name of the waveform.
                             ## 
  data*: WaveData            ## The waveform data.
                             ##
Container for a waveform to use on CH3. Source   Edit   
WaveformTable = Table[Waveform]
Container for Waveforms. Up to 64 Waveforms can be stored in this table and is addressable via a TableId. Source   Edit  

Consts

defaultRpb = 4
Default rowsPerBeat setting for new Songs Source   Edit   
defaultRpm = 16
Default rowsPerMeasure setting for new Songs Source   Edit   
defaultSpeed: Speed = 0x00000060
Default speed setting for new Songs. The default is 6.0 frames/row or approximately 160 BPM. Source   Edit   
defaultTickrate = (system: systemDmg, customFramerate: 30.0)
Default tickrate setting for new Modules. Source   Edit   
defaultTrackSize: TrackLen = 64
Default length of a Track for new Songs. Source   Edit   
unitSpeed = 16
Constant for a speed value that is exactly 1 frame/row Source   Edit  

Procs

func `$`(s: Sequence): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringify operator for Sequences. The string returned can be passed to parseSequence to get the original sequence. Source   Edit   
func `$`(wave: WaveData): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringify operator for WaveData. The data is represented as a string of 32 uppercase hex characters, with the first character being the first sample in the wave data. Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: SomeTable): bool {....raises: [].}
Equality test for two tables. Uses deep equality checking. Source   Edit   
func `==`(a, b: SongList): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Equality test for two song lists. Uses deep equality checking. Source   Edit

Source   Edit

    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets an immutable reference to the song at the ith index in the list. Source   Edit

    forbids: [].}
Gets a mutable reference to the song at the ith index in the list. Source   Edit

    forbids: [].}
Access the order via row index. index must be in range of 0..o.len-1 Source   Edit

Gets an immutable ref of the item with the given id or nil if there is no item with that id. Source   Edit   
proc `[]`[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]; id: TableId): ref T {....raises: [].}
Gets a ref of the item with the given id or nil if there is no item with that id. Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(l: var SongList; i: ByteIndex; s: ref Song) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Replaces the song at the ith index in the list with s. An AssertionDefect will be raised if s was nil. Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(o: var Order; index: Natural; val: OrderRow) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Modifies the order row via a row index. index must be in range of 0..o.len-1 Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(s: var Sequence; i: ByteIndex; val: uint8) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Sets the ith element in the sequence to the given val Source   Edit   
proc `[]=`(t: var Track; i: ByteIndex; v: TrackRow) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Replaces the ith row in the track with the given one. Source   Edit   
proc add(l: var SongList) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Adds a new song to the end of the list. An AssertionDefect will be raised if the list is at maximum capacity. Source   Edit   
proc add(l: var SongList; song: ref Song) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Adds song to the end of the list. An AssertionDefect will be raised if the list is at maximum capacity or if song was nil. Source   Edit   
proc add[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]): TableId {....raises: [].}
Adds a new item to the table using the next available id. If the table is at capacity, an AssertionDefect will be raised. Source   Edit   
proc add[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]; id: TableId) {....raises: [].}
Adds a new item using the given id. An AssertionDefect will be raised if the table is at capacity, or if the id is already in use. Source   Edit   
proc capacity[T: SomeData](t: Table[T]): static[int] {....raises: [].}
Maximum number of items that can be stored in a Table. Source   Edit   
func contains[T: SomeData](t: Table[T]; id: TableId): bool {....raises: [].}
Determines if the table contains an item with the id Source   Edit   
proc data(o: Order): lent seq[OrderRow] {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func data(s: Sequence): lent seq[uint8] {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
proc data=(o: var Order; data: sink seq[OrderRow]) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Assigns the Order's data to the given sequence. data.len must be in the range of a PositiveByte, otherwise an AssertionDefect will be raised. Source   Edit   
proc data=(s: var Sequence; data: sink seq[uint8]) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Assigns the sequence's data to the given uint8 sequence. data.len must not exceed 256 or an AssertionDefect will be raised. Source   Edit   
proc duplicate(l: var SongList; i: ByteIndex) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Duplicates the song at the ith index in the list and adds it to the end of the list. An AssertionDefect is raised if the list is at maximum capacity. Source   Edit   
proc duplicate[T: SomeData](t: var Table[T]; id: TableId): TableId {....raises: [].}
Adds a copy of the item with the given id, using the next available id. An AssertionDefect is raised if the item to copy does not exist, or if the table is at capacity. Source   Edit   
func effectTypeShortensPattern(et: EffectType): bool {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Determines if the given effect type will shorten the runtime length of a pattern by either halting the song or jumping to a new pattern. Source   Edit   
proc estimateSpeed(s: Song; tempo, framerate: float): Speed {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculate the closest speed value for the given tempo, in beats per minute, and framerate in hertz. Source   Edit   
proc getRow(s: Song; ch: ChannelId; order, row: ByteIndex): TrackRow {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets the track row for the channel, order row (pattern id), and row in the pattern. If there was no such row, an empty row is returned. Source   Edit   
proc getRow(s: var Song; ch: ChannelId; order, row: ByteIndex): var TrackRow {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func getTickrate(m: Module; song: ByteIndex): Tickrate {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the tickrate for the given song id. The tickrate returned will be the song's tickrate override if set, otherwise it will be the module's tickrate. Source   Edit   
func getTrack(s: var Song; ch: ChannelId; order: ByteIndex): Track {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Source   Edit   
func getTrackView(s: Song; ch: ChannelId; order: ByteIndex): TrackView {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets a copy of the track for the given channel and track id. If there is no track for this address, an invalid Track is returned. Note that this proc returns a copy! For non-copying access use the viewTrack template. Source   Edit   
func hertz(t: Tickrate): float {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Converts the given tickrate to a rate in hertz. Source   Edit   
func init(T: typedesc[Instrument]): Instrument {....raises: [].}
Value constructor for an Instrument. Default initialization is used, so the instrument's channel is ch1, and all its sequences are empty. Source   Edit   
func init(T: typedesc[Module]): Module {....raises: [].}
Value constructor for a new module. The returned module has:
  • 1 empty song
  • an empty instrument and waveform table
  • empty comments and artist information
  • tickrate set to defaultTickrate (59.7 Hz)
  • version information with the current application version and file revision
Source   Edit   
func init(T: typedesc[Order]): Order {....raises: [].}
Value constructor for an Order. The Order is initialized with a single row all having a track id of 0. Source   Edit   
func init(T: typedesc[SomeTable]): T.typeOf {....raises: [].}
Value constructor for a new table. The returned table is empty. Source   Edit   
func init(T: typedesc[Song]): Song {....raises: [].}
Value constructor for a new Song. The returned song is initialized with default settings. Source   Edit

Converters

    forbids: [].}
Implicit conversion of a string to an InfoString. Only the first 32 characters of str are copied if str.len is greater than 32. Source   Edit  

Templates

template editPattern(s: var Song; orderNo: ByteIndex; value, body: untyped): untyped
Edits an entire pattern in place for the given orderNo or index in the song order. value is the name of the template that returns a var Track in the pattern for a given ChannelId, which is accessible in body.

Example:

var song = Song.init()
# edit the first pattern such that:
#  - the first row in ch1's track has the note set to D#2
#  - the first row in ch2's track has effect#2 set to etTuning with a param of 0x82
song.editPattern(0, pattern):
  pattern(ch1).setNote(0, 3)
  pattern(ch2).setEffect(0, 1, etTuning, 0x82)
song.viewPattern(0, pattern):
  doAssert pattern(ch1)[0] == TrackRow(note: 0x4u8)
  const expected = block:
    var row: TrackRow
    row.effects[1] = Effect(effectType: etTuning.ord.uint8, param: 0x82)
    row
  doAssert pattern(ch2)[0] == expected
Source   Edit   
template editTrack(s: var Song; ch: ChannelId; trackId: ByteIndex;
                   value, body: untyped): untyped
Edit a channel's track in place via its track id. value is the name of the template that returns a var Track of the track to edit that is accessible in body.

Example:

var song = Song.init()
song.editTrack(ch3, 0, track):
  track.setNote(1, 10)
  track.setInstrument(4, 0)
song.viewTrack(ch3, 0, track):
  doAssert track[1].note == 11
  doAssert track[4].instrument == 1
Source   Edit   
template viewPattern(s: Song; orderNo: ByteIndex; value, body: untyped): untyped

Similar to editPattern but instead only provides read-only access to all tracks in the pattern. value is the name of the template that returns a lent Track in the pattern for a given ChannelId, which is accessible in body.

Same as viewTrack, if any track in the pattern does not exist, an invalid one will take its place.

See the example in editPattern for example usage.

Source   Edit   
template viewTrack(s: Song; ch: ChannelId; trackId: ByteIndex;
                   value, body: untyped): untyped

Similar to editTrack but instead only provides read-only access to a track, in place. value is the name of the template that returns a lent Track of the track to view that is accessible in body.

If the track does not exist, then value will refer to an invalid track, or a track with 0 rows.

See the example in editTrack for example usage.

Source   Edit

Pcm, PositiveByte, pansRight, isNil, PcmF32, ByteIndex, ==, MixMode, ==, ChannelId, pansLeft, ==, toImmutable, Immutable, [], []
